content.description: Good bolted protection.  Can clip first bolt from excellent ramp stance unless you are very short.  All holds are solid
content.protection: quickdraws, 2 bolt anchor w/ quick links
content.location: farthest right bolted line at Echo Dome.  Start from the ground and move up the easy ramp to get to the first bolt.

content.description: Crux is gaining last crack.  All rock is solid.  Nice trad lead.
content.protection: Regular refuge trad.  cams and stoppers.  2 bolt anchor at top.  Can be double rapped
content.location: left of Wormhole, Right of Frosted Flakes

content.description: Crux is first two bolts.  Solid 5.10 moves off the ground.  After big ledge, its all gravy.
content.protection: quickdraws, 2 bolt anchor at top, can be double rapped
content.location: leftmost bolted route at Echo Dome

content.description: Slabby bottom section with slightly overhanging crux.
content.protection: Bolts. Bolt hangers are missing and need to be replaced. One (good) bolt anchor without a hanger. Otherwise a trad anchor.
content.location: First face climb to the right of Worm Hole.

content.protection: quickdraws, 2 bolt anchor, can be double rapped
content.location: The bolted line between the two prominent cracks.

content.description: Start left of Worm Hole and climb a leaning "ramp" up to the blank face. The climbing here becomes thin and devious. Reach an undercling "wafer" hold. The rock here is just a shell over the main face - use caution to not break through. Step up over the shell/wafer hold and onto another slab. The slab eventually eases.
content.protection: Top rope this route from the anchors on Worm Hole.
content.location: This line climbs the blank face right of Worm Hole. You can TR the route from the Worm Hole anchors.

content.description: Small diheadral with a crack for pro. i use this as an approach for setting a TR on echo dome
content.location: right side of echo dome, 25 right of Worm Hole. Used this as Approach for setting gear at top of Echo.

content.description: This route is the extension to Little sherman creature crack.  Instead of traversing right when the hand crack peters out, pull up onto the headwall for some stemming and finger crack action.  I clipped the last bolt on frosted flakes and finished at those anchors.
content.protection: Same gear as that on Sherman Creature and then I placed a #5 BD Nut and clipped the last bolt of frosted flakes.  May want to consult the guidebook.
content.location: This is the Sherman Creature Crack extension, it is very obvious.

content.description: Crux is near the top.  Pro gets thin.
content.location: left of frosted flakes, right of Ladybugs and Gentlemen

content.description: Shady morning. Full sun afternoon.  Good winter wall.  Sometimes crowded (3 groups). Excellent rock quality.  Pull DOWN not out on flakes.  They are solid down, possibly not out.
